title: 1936 Sugar Bowl
text:
The 1936 Sugar Bowl, part of the <a href="1935%E2%80%9336%20NCAA%20football%20bowl%20games">1935–36 bowl game</a> season, took place on January 1, 1936, at <a href="Tulane%20Stadium">Tulane Stadium</a> in <a href="New%20Orleans">New Orleans, Louisiana</a>. The competing teams were the <a href="1935%20LSU%20Tigers%20football%20team">LSU Tigers</a>, representing the <a href="Southeastern%20Conference">Southeastern Conference</a> (SEC), and the <a href="1935%20TCU%20Horned%20Frogs%20football%20team">TCU Horned Frogs</a>, representing the <a href="Southwest%20Conference">Southwest Conference</a> (SWC). TCU won the game, 3–2.
Teams.
LSU.
The 1935 LSU squad finished the regular season 9–1 and as SEC champions with loss coming against <a href="1935%20Rice%20Owls%20football%20team">Rice</a> in the season opener. The Sugar Bowl appearance marked the first ever postseason <a href="bowl%20game">bowl game</a> for LSU.
TCU.
The 1935 TCU squad finished the regular season with a record of 11–1. The only loss of the season came in their final conference game against <a href="1935%20SMU%20Mustangs%20football%20team">SMU</a> by a score of 20–14. The appearance marked the first for TCU in the Sugar bowl and the second all-time bowl appearance.
Game summary.
In a game dominated by both defenses, all five points were scored in the second quarter. TCU's Taldon Manton scored first on a 36-yard <a href="Field%20goal%20%28American%20and%20Canadian%20football%29">field goal</a>. LSU scored their only points when <a href="Sammy%20Baugh">Sammy Baugh</a> was called for a <a href="Safety%20%28American%20football%20score%29">safety</a> after being pressured by <a href="Gaynell%20Tinsley">Gaynell Tinsley</a>, and called for <a href="intentional%20grounding">intentional grounding</a>.
